description: DCAT v2 dataset entries.
Local database identifier of the dataset.
A name given to the record.
A free-text account of the item.
Reference back to any catalogs that contain this dataset.
Reference to one or more Distributions to make table data and/or remote file(s) metadata available in the FDP.
The frequency at which dataset is published.
The geographical area covered by the dataset.
Minimum spatial separation resolvable in a dataset, measured in meters.
The temporal period that the dataset covers.
Minimum time period resolvable in the dataset.
An activity that generated, or provides the business context for, the creation of the dataset.
Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
Relevant contact information for the cataloged resource. Use of vCard is recommended [VCARD-RDF].
The entity responsible for producing the resource.
An ODRL conformant policy expressing the rights associated with the resource.
A unique identifier of the item.
A related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to the cataloged resource.
A keyword or tag describing the resource.
A Web page that can be navigated to in a Web browser to gain access to the catalog, a dataset, its distributions and/or additional information.
A legal document under which the resource is made available.

A language of the item. This refers to the natural language used for textual metadata (i.e. titles, descriptions, etc) of a cataloged resource (i.e. dataset or service) or the textual values of a dataset distribution.
A resource with an unspecified relationship to the cataloged item.
A statement that concerns all rights not addressed with dct:license or dct:accessRights, such as copyright statements.
Link to a description of a relationship with another resource.
The entity responsible for making the item available.
A main category of the resource. A resource can have multiple themes.
The nature or genre of the resource.
Link to an Agent having some form of responsibility for the resource
A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place.
